subject: Real Estate
title: Boundary Disputes: Where's the Line?
description: A quick win: understand Boundary Disputes: Where's the Line?.

hook.text: Your neighbor builds a fence two feet onto your property. Is it theirs now? Can you make them move it?

buildup.text: Boundary disputes arise when property lines are unclear, surveys conflict, or fences don't match deeds.

discovery.text: A licensed surveyor can stake the legal boundary, but surveys can differ depending on methodology.

twist.text: If the fence has been in the wrong spot for decades, adverse possession might give the neighbor a legal claim.

climax.text: Boundary disputes destroy neighbor relationships and can cost more in legal fees than the land is worth.

punchline.text: Two feet of dirt can cost thousands in legal fees.

quiz.question: How are boundary disputes typically resolved?
options: A surveyor stakes the legal boundary
